title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Brooklyn Heights

content.rendered:
It’s easy to see why Brooklyn Heights is regarded as “America’s original suburb,” with its tree-lined walkways, cobblestone side streets, and flourishing mix of commercial and community-focused enterprises. Are you planning to move to this beautiful neighborhood? Well, before making the big move, here’s your neighborhood guide covering all the key info. Keep it handy for details on average rent and restaurants in Brooklyn Heights that will make your search for rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights much easier.

Let’s get started!

Where is Brooklyn Heights?

Located along the East River, Brooklyn Heights is an upscale neighborhood comprised of iconic brownstones. It’s famed for its tree-lined East River promenade, which offers unmatched vistas of Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty. Both native New Yorkers and newcomers to the city love this area’s unique vibes, numerous shopping options, and easy access to public transportation.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In East Bronx

Find Rooms For Rent in Brooklyn Heights

Find Rooms For Rent In Brooklyn Heights

The styles of Brooklyn Heights apartments are as varied as they are expensive. Doorman buildings are unusual because most buildings were converted from single-family units and rowhouses. However, well-kept or freshly renovated apartments are the norm. At virtually every turn, tucked-away courtyards, archways, and side street gardens contribute to the courtly appeal.

Average Rent in Brooklyn Heights

Quiet streetscapes, old buildings, and a general sense of establishment combine to create a neighborhood that feels worlds away from New York’s usual rush and bustle while still being close to all of the city’s most thrilling attractions. Many of the residents are young families and elite professionals. Moreover, you can find a roommate to help you save money on your basic living expenses.

Is Brooklyn Heights safe?

Before you decide to move here, you will find yourself wondering, ‘is Brooklyn Heights safe’? Here are a few apps that provide useful neighborhood insights that make the process of finding rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights hassle-free. Moreover, you get access to vital information – all for free!

  • Niche: This site provides a comprehensive, neighborhood-specific report. It elaborates on various rankings, safety rates, education, real estate, and resident reviews.
  • NextDoor: The best way to keep updated about what’s going on in your area is to use NextDoor. It’s a private social network for your neighborhood, where you can exchange safety tips, report suspicious activities, and even arrange a last-minute babysitter.
  • AroundMe: AroundMe does a great job of helping you find nearby hospitals, supermarkets, pharmacies, and more. Also, it gives you current pricing, directions, and more to help you make a quick choice. It’s an essential app to refer to while looking for rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights.
  • Hotline Numbers: 911 and 311 are the two helpful numbers New York residents use to get info or for emergencies. Basically, 311 is a type of citizens’ hotline. It’s a simple way for you to report problems or ask questions about your community without tying up emergency lines or going through frustrating municipal channels. You can call to report issues like abandoned vehicles, road repairs, noise complaints, and graffiti. By adding a second channel for citizens to report problems, 911 operators are free to address emergencies.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Jerome Park

Public Transit in Brooklyn Heights

1. Walkability

This neighborhood is the 29th most walkable neighborhood in New York, with a Walk Score of 97. With eateries at every corner, it’s a walker’s paradise! Moreover, daily errands do not require a car; you can complete them easily on foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

The city that never sleeps does have some pockets of serenity. According to RentOwnSell, Brooklyn Heights is the 2nd most quiet neighborhood in the borough.

3. Nearby Train Stations

Being familiar with transit options can help save time while looking for rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights.

All Subway Stations

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in West Bronx

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The following transit lines have routes that pass near the neighborhood:

  • B41, B57, B62, M20, M55.

Restaurants in Brooklyn Heights

While looking for rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights, don’t forget to explore some of the many restaurants in the neighborhood. Nothing compares to the flavor of the authentic cuisine that’s served at many restaurants in Brooklyn Heights.

1. Beasts & Bottles

The restaurant’s owners are from Provence, which explains the delicious chicken Provençale. The menu also includes steaks, fish, and vegetarian-friendly pastas and sides. This place comes first among the most spectacular restaurants in Brooklyn Heights.

Website

2. Colonie

Serving a seasonal, often local, American menu with Italian influences, Colonie’s food is made up of simple vegetable dishes, homemade pasta, and fresh seafood. All of this adds up to make it one of the greatest restaurants in Brooklyn Heights!

Website

3. Boutros

If you’re looking for Middle Eastern food, there aren’t many restaurants in Brooklyn Heights that can compare to this one. Situated on Atlantic Avenue’s stretch of long-standing Middle Eastern restaurants, Boutros serves a creative, modern interpretation of the region’s cuisine.

Website

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn

Parks in Brooklyn Heights

In addition to variety of rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights districts, it also boasts some attractive outdoor spaces. The neighborhood offers gorgeous greenways where you can look at the city skyline while enjoying some exciting recreational activities.

  • Brooklyn Heights Promenade
  • Brooklyn Bridge Park
  • Adam Yauch Park
  • Brooklyn Bridge Park
  • Cadman Plaza Park

Related: Things To Do In Brooklyn With Your Roommates!

Grocery Stores in Brooklyn Heights

1. Trader Joe’s

Grocery stores in Brooklyn Heights are plenty, but Trader Joe’s stands out for its variety. It really is a one-stop grocery store! Step inside and you’ll find unconventional and interesting products like Mandarin Orange Chicken and Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate. Also, everyday basics like milk, eggs, meat, and fresh produce.

2. Key Food Supermarkets

Having grocery stores near potential rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights is a must!

This chain offers groceries and general merchandise, such as cleaning supplies and beauty products. Moreover, you can order groceries from their online store in a click!

3. Perelandra

Besides being popular for quick snacks and amazing smoothies, Perelandra is a great supermarket. Stop here for organic, healthy food to go (chili sin carne, seitan bahn-mi, gluten-free chocolate truffles, and the like).

This store is also known to provide excellent customer service in all of Brooklyn Heights’ grocery stores!

With this we’ve come to the end of our neighborhood guide to Brooklyn Heights. Happy moving!

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Brooklyn Heights? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
